attributes.description:
This table provides a detailed, event-level view of all anomalies detected by the CCI-000832 ML jobs. It serves as the primary tool for deep-dive investigations.

**Why and When It's Used:**
When a trend chart shows a high anomaly score, this table is the next step. It provides the ground truth for the anomaly, showing the exact time, the job that triggered, the severity score, and the specific entities (influencers) involved. Use this to get the context needed for a full investigation.

**How an Analyst Can Use It:**
Filter this table by a specific `job_id` and time range to investigate a spike from one of the trend charts. Sort by `anomaly_score` in descending order to prioritize the most severe anomalies. The influencer columns (`host.name`, `user.name`, `signal.rule.name`) will tell you exactly who or what was involved in the anomalous activity.
attributes.title: [IR-5, CCI-000832] ML - Detailed Anomalies

attributes.description:
**Why and when this visualization works:**
This metric provides an immediate, at-a-glance count of all security signals that have been escalated to a case, representing formally documented incidents. Use it as a quick health check to gauge the overall volume of documented incident response activity.

**How an analyst can use it:**
This number directly reflects your documented incidents. A zero count when signals are present elsewhere is a red flag. A high count indicates a busy response team. Correlate this number with the total signal count to understand your signal-to-case ratio.
attributes.title: [CCI-000832] Total Documented Incidents (Cases)

attributes.description: This visualization displays the health status for CCI-000832 based on the anomaly scores from associated ML jobs. The color indicates the maximum anomaly score detected across jobs that monitor for unusual signal volume, severity spikes, triage backlogs, and noisy hosts, which are all indicators of incident tracking and documentation effectiveness. Green indicates normal activity (score < 20), yellow indicates a minor anomaly (score 20-99), and red indicates a critical anomaly (score >= 100) that requires immediate investigation.
attributes.title: [CCI-000832] Incident Monitoring ML Score

attributes.description:
**Why and when this visualization works:**
This chart provides a quick overview of the documentation status of your security signals. It shows how many have been escalated to a case versus those that are still just open signals. This is key to ensuring that signals are being triaged and that the important ones are formally documented.

**How an analyst can use it:**
Review the distribution. A very large number of signals that are not in a case could indicate a triage backlog. A healthy distribution shows a manageable number of open signals and a steady flow into cases. You can click on either segment of the donut to filter the detailed table below.
attributes.title: [CCI-000832] Signal Documentation Status
attributes.visState: {"title":"[CCI-000832] Signal Documentation Status","type":"pie","aggs":[{"id":"1","enabled":true,"type":"count","params":{"emptyAsNull":false},"schema":"metric"},{"id":"2","enabled":true,"type":"filters","params":{"filters":[{"input":{"language":"kuery","query":"cases.status: *"},"label":"Documented in Case"},{"input":{"language":"kuery","query":"NOT cases.status: *"},"label":"Signal Not in Case"}]},"schema":"segment"}],"params":{"addTooltip":true,"addLegend":true,"legendPosition":"right","isDonut":true,"type":"pie","legendDisplay":"hide","nestedLegend":false,"truncateLegend":true,"maxLegendLines":1,"distinctColors":false,"emptySizeRatio":0.3,"palette":{"type":"palette","name":"default"},"labels":{"show":true,"last_level":false,"values":true,"valuesFormat":"percent","percentDecimals":2,"truncate":100,"position":"default"}}}

attributes.description:
**Why and when this visualization works:**
This table provides the definitive, granular proof of incident tracking and documentation. It lists individual security signals, allowing an analyst to see which rule was triggered and whether the signal was escalated to a case. This is the core visualization for verifying that the full process is being followed.

**How an analyst can use it:**
Filter for a specific component (e.g., 'host.name'). Review this table to see all security signals from that component. The 'Documentation Status' column is critical; use it to confirm that high-priority signals are being documented. If a signal is documented, you can see its case details. If not, this is an opportunity to investigate why.
attributes.title: [CCI-000832] Detailed Signal and Case Log

attributes.description:
**Why and when this visualization works:**
This trend chart is essential for understanding the volume of incoming security signals over time, representing all trackable events. It helps visualize your environment's security posture and the workload for your analysts before documentation occurs. Spikes indicate a potential attack or misconfiguration that needs investigation.

**How an analyst can use it:**
Monitor the trend for anomalies. A large, sudden spike in signals should be investigated immediately. Use the time range selector to zoom in on periods of interest and correlate with the detailed log to see which detection rules are firing. This chart shows the start of the 'tracking' process.
attributes.title: [CCI-000832] Incoming Security Signals Trend (converted)

Monitor this trend to gauge the triage team's workload.
